display_name.description: The name displayed in Anki's UI (e.g. in the add-on list)

module_name.description: The module/package the add-on is imported as, i.e. the name of the add-on folder.

repo_name.description: The name of the git repository the add-on is hosted in. Currently only used for build names.

local_name_suffix.description: A suffix to the display name to apply when creating builds for non-ankiweb distribution.

version.description: Add-on version string. Needs to follow semantic versioning guidelines.

author.description: The main author/maintainer/publisher of the add-on.

contact.description: Contact details to list for the author (e.g. either a website or email)

homepage.description: Homepage of the add-on project (e.g. GitHub repository link)

tags.description: Space-delimited list of tags that characterize the add-on on AnkiWeb.

copyright_start.description: Starting year to list for automatically generated copyright headers.

conflicts.description: A list of other AnkiWeb add-on IDs or package names that conflict with this add-on.

min_anki_version.description: SemVer version string describing the minimum required Anki version to run this add-on.

max_anki_version.description: SemVer version string describing the maximum supported Anki version of this add-on

tested_anki_version.description: SemVer version string describing the latest Anki version this add-on was tested on.
